alert.note: Alert for Ashtabula Inland; Ashtabula Lakeshore; Cuyahoga; Geauga; Lake (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued November 19 at 2:42PM EST until November 20 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph near the lakeshore. Elsewhere, winds gusting to as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Cuyahoga, Lake, Geauga, Ashtabula Inland and Ashtabula Lakeshore counties. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As a cold front moves through the area tonight, a burst of heavier snow is expected before organized effect snow bands develop overnight. These organized lake effect snow bands will continue through Sunday evening with locally intense snowfall rates. These bands may persist in the vicinity of Lake and Geauga Counties, where locally higher snow amounts are favored. Gusty winds off Lake Erie will allow for blowing snow and additional reduced visibility, especially in Lake, Geauga, and Ashtabula Counties. There will be a sharp cutoff in snowfall amounts for Cuyahoga County, especially west of Interstate 77 and south of Interstate 480. Wind chills in the single digits are expected Sunday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Ashtabula Inland; Ashtabula Lakeshore; Cuyahoga; Geauga; Lake
